item.text: A proof-of-work (POW) system (or [[Protocol]], or [[Function]]) is an economic measure to deter denial of service attacks and other service abuses such as spam on a network by requiring some work from the service requester, usually meaning processing time by a computer.
It is distinct from a [[CAPTCHA]], which is intended for a human to solve quickly, rather than a computer.

A proof-of-work (POW) system (or [[Protocol]], or [[Function]]) is an economic measure to deter [[Denial of Service Attack]]s and other service abuses such as [[Spam]] on a network by requiring some work from the service requester, usually meaning processing time by a computer.

story.text: A proof-of-work (POW) system (or [[Protocol]], or [[Function]]) is an economic measure to deter [[Denial of Service Attack]]s and other service abuses such as [[Spam]] on a network by requiring some work from the service requester, usually meaning processing time by a computer.
It is distinct from a [[CAPTCHA]], which is intended for a human to solve quickly, rather than a computer.
